Title: 71920-Maintain Users-User search screen -OnLoad, Search and Action Navigation

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search User Screen must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action:
Verify  following search fields are displayed 
User ID
Name
Role 
County(Drop down)
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.Users should be able to search based on the values entered in the search fields\n\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify  wildcard search functionality for below fields\n User ID\n Name
Test Steps.Step Expected: User ID and Name must be wildcard searchable

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that records are fetched and displayed according to the selected dropdown values -County(Drop down)
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.County drop down must display appropriated values based on the environment \n2.

Test Steps.Step Action:
Verify column sorting for below fields
User ID
Name
Role 
County
Date Created
Date Modified
End Date
Status
Test Steps.Step Expected: All Columns can be sorted ascending or descending order.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify Pagination
Test Steps.Step Expected: Verify that the user can navigate to the next and previous pages

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify Search button functionality
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Search button should return relevant results based on the input criteria

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify Reset button functionality
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Reset button should clear all input fields and restore the default search settings

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify ADD button functionality
Test Steps.Step Expected: Add New User Screen must be displayed.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify Action button functionality
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.EDIT - Must navigate to Update User Screen\n2.RESET PASSWORD-Must navigate to User Management screen, where the user’s password can be cleared and reset via Okta \n3.DELETE USER- Must Navigate to the User Management screen, where the user can be deleted

Title: 71921-Maintain Users-Create User Screen - Add/Maintain User Details

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users>Actions>\nEdit
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update User screen must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action:
Verify the following input fields are displayed 

First Name
Middle Name
Last Name
Email Address
Phone Number
Region
Test Steps.Step Expected: Must be displayed on Update User screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify UPDATE button is displayed
Test Steps.Step Expected: Must update the record successfully and navigate back to the user search screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify CANCEL button is displayed
Test Steps.Step Expected: Should not update the record and navigate back to the user search screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify ADD button is displayed
Test Steps.Step Expected: Must navigate to 'Add User Role' Screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the dropdown values
Test Steps.Step Expected: The roles created through the 'Maintain Roles' screen must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify Assign Roles & Permissions grid
Test Steps.Step Expected: Must display Role names and Actions

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify Pagination
Test Steps.Step Expected: The pagination functionality should work correctly

Test Steps.Step Action: Add a role and verify that it is correctly associated with the user
Test Steps.Step Expected: The added role must be displayed in the Role column on the User Search screen

Test Steps.Step Action: \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Title: 71917-Maintain Users-User search screen -Assign Multiple roles to User

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users>Actions>\nEdit
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update User screen must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on ADD and  Select a role displayed in the Drop down values and click on SAVE
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1."User Role"  assigned successfully message must be displayed\n2.User must navigate to 'Update User ' Screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the added Role is assigned correctly to the User
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.Must be displayed in the  Assign Role & Permissions Page under Role Name column \n2.Must be displayed in the Search User Page under Role Name column

Test Steps.Step Action: Attempt to reassign the role that is already assigned to the user
Test Steps.Step Expected: "Role already assigned to User" message must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Add multiple roles to the same User
Test Steps.Step Expected: System must successfully assign multiple roles to a User

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on ADD and  Select a role displayed in the Drop down values and click on Cancel
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user must navigate to the 'Update User' screen without assigning any roles

Title: 71915 - ES - User Mgmt - Assign Resource Permissions to Roles (State User) Assign Resource Permissions to Roles

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisites:\n- Have an existing Role
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Roles
Test Steps.Step Expected: Roles And Permissions page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Use the search criteria to find your existing Role
Test Steps.Step Expected: Role found

Test Steps.Step Action: Next to the existing Role click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Edit"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update Role page is displayed and the "Select Permissions" area will be displayed below

Test Steps.Step Action: Select any option from the "Resources" dropdown and then click "ASSIGN" e.g. Region
Test Steps.Step Expected:
A Resource table will be created below and the Resource that was assigned will be displayed with the following columns:
- View (tick box)
- Create (tick box)
- Edit (tick box)
- Delete (tick box)

Test Steps.Step Action: Tick any desired options e.g. enable the "View" and "Create" permissions and disable "Edit" and "Delete" permissions
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options ticked

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "UPDATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success message will be displayed and the user will be taken back to the Role and Permissions search page

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the updated Role and click on the Actions ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Edit"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update Role page will be displayed and the Resource permission options will be pre-populated based on the changes you previously made e.g. "View' and "Create" permissions will be enabled

Title: 71976-Maintain User-User Search Screen - Reset Password (OKTA)-Outlook Email

Test Steps.Step Action: Precondition; A valid user ID and outlook email address associated with the role
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users
Test Steps.Step Expected: User Search Screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on  Actions->Reset Password
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1."Operation successful" message must be displayed \n2.The user must receive an email containing a 'Reset Password' link

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the 'Reset Password' and enter new password
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Okta system must successfully complete the password reset process

Test Steps.Step Action: Log in to the Elections system using the new password
Test Steps.Step Expected: User must be able to login successfully with the new password

Test Steps.Step Action: Precondition; A valid system user with a valid Email address associated with the role
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users
Test Steps.Step Expected: User Search Page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on  Actions->Reset Password
Test Steps.Step Expected: "A reset password link will be sent to user's e-mail. Click Ok, to continue. Otherwise click Cancel button." pop-up message must be displayed on the page.\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Cancel Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: User continues to stay on "User Search Page"

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "Ok" Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1."Operation Successful" message is displayed on the Page\n2.The user must receive an email containing a 'Reset Password' link

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the 'Reset Password' and enter new password
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Okta system must successfully complete the password reset process

Test Steps.Step Action: Log in to the Elections system using the new password
Test Steps.Step Expected: User must be able to login successfully with the new password

Test Steps.Step Action: Try Logging to the system with the previous password
Test Steps.Step Expected: User should be unable to login and access the System

Title: Maintain User-User Search Screen->Delete User Role

Test Steps.Step Action: The user ID must be associated with at least one user role.
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users
Test Steps.Step Expected: User Search Screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a User ID from the grid that has at least one user role assigned and click on Actions->Edit
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update User Screen must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "Actions->Delete" in the "Assign Roles and Permissions" section
Test Steps.Step Expected: "User Role deleted successfully" message must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Precondition: A valid user ID in "Active" status
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users
Test Steps.Step Expected: User Search Screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on  Actions->Suspend
Test Steps.Step Expected: Do you really want to suspend the user?click ok to continue otherwise click cancel button message with 'OK' and 'Cancel' button must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "Cancel"
Test Steps.Step Expected: No changes should be made to the user's status

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "OK"
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1."Operation successful" message must be displayed \n2.User status column must be updated to "suspended"

Test Steps.Step Action: Try logging to the Election Management System with the suspended User ID
Test Steps.Step Expected: "Unable to sign in" message must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users
Test Steps.Step Expected: User Search Screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a User in suspend status from the grid results and Click on  Actions->UnSuspend
Test Steps.Step Expected: Do you really want to Unsuspend the user?click ok to continue otherwise click cancel button message with 'OK' and 'Cancel' button must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "Cancel"
Test Steps.Step Expected: No changes should be made to the user's status

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "OK"
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1."Operation successful" message must be displayed \n2.User status column must be updated to "Active"

Test Steps.Step Action: Try logging to the Election Management System with the Unsuspended User ID
Test Steps.Step Expected: User should be able to login successfully

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Users > Maintain Users
Test Steps.Step Expected: User Search Screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a valid User in active status and then Click on Actions->Deactivate
Test Steps.Step Expected:
1.Are you sure you want to Deactivate this user? This action cannot be undone. Click OK ,tocontinue. otherwise click cancel button.
2. 'OK' and 'Cancel' button must be
displayed on the pop up window and must be enabled

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Cancel button
Test Steps.Step Expected: User must remain on the User search page.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on OK
Test Steps.Step Expected:
1."Operation successful" message must be displayed 
2.User status column must be updated to "Deactivated"

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the Deactivated User is displayed in the search results grid
Test Steps.Step Expected: Deactivated User must be displayed in the search results grid and cannot be reactivated

Test Steps.Step Action: Try logging to the Election Management System with the Deactivated User ID
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user should not be able to log in and access the system.
